intro: Tristemma angolense, commonly known as the Angolan tristemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Tristemma angolense is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soils.
